We have found 1-heteroaryl-2-aryl- 1H-benzimidazole derivatives that have selectivity for JNK3 through optimisation of a hit compound exhibiting JNK activity from our library in previous studies
12 . Based on the SAR results, we continued our efforts to design a new chemical scaffold of JNK3 inhibitors with reduced molecular weights for better Brain-Blood Barrier permeability
13
,
14 . During the development of new JNK3-selective inhibitors, we sought to maintain three interactions of the previous scaffold; hydrogen bonds in the hinge region, hydrophobic interaction of the aromatic ring, and the hydrogen bond of phenol in the benzimidazole scaffold, thus attempting to reduce the molecular weight. Therefore, we discarded benzene from the benzimidazole scaffold, retaining the hydrogen bond-possible moiety on 5-membered ring with final design and synthesis of the 3-alkyl-5-aryl-1-pyrimidyl-1 H-pyrazole derivatives ( Figure 1).
